H0.text: Atmosphere is the thin layer of rock on Earth's surface.

H1.text: Hemisphere is the thin layer of rock on Earth's surface.

H2.text: Hydrosphere is the thin layer of rock on Earth's surface.

H3.text: Lithosphere is the thin layer of rock on Earth's surface.

A4.text: The oldest oceanic lithosphere is about 140 kilometres (87 mi) thick.

A5.text: The lithosphere is composed of the crust and the lithospheric mantle, the topmost portion of the upper mantle that behaves elastically on time scales of up to thousands of years or more.
